german.subject: German
german.question0: The student often volunteers to read and enjoys reading books from the classroom library.
german.question1: The student reads very fluently and with emphasis.
german.question2: The student participates very actively in spelling exercises, applying learned strategies.
german.question3: The student demonstrates confidence in naming parts of speech.
german.question4: The student revises his/her own texts reliably after writing conferences.
german.question5: The student plans his/her writing in a planned manner.

math.subject: Mathematics
math.question0: The student shows confidence in dealing with large natural numbers (millions, billions).
math.question1: The student knows how to take a survey and display the results on a graph.
math.question2: The student demonstrates confidence in written arithmetic procedures (+, -, : , -).
math.question3: The student has a very good command of the 1x1.

eng.subject: English
eng.question0: The student responds to the teacher's English work instructions.
eng.question1: The student learns vocabulary regularly and repeats it continuously.
eng.question2: The student appears confident and well-prepared when presenting in English.
eng.question3: The student independently clarifies unknown words and their pronunciation using the Internet/dictionary.

sci.subject: Science
sci.question0: The student shows interest in scientific work (observation, experimentation, research).
sci.question1: The student uses technical terms correctly.
sci.question2: The student independently uses different sources of information and media.
sci.question3: The student understands the connection between the everyday world and scientific knowledge.

music.subject: Music
music.question0: The student perceives musical sounds consciously through attentive listening.
music.question1: The student expresses his or her opinion on different musical genres and thereby recognizes his or her own preferences.
music.question2: The student enjoys (re)producing musical sounds (singing, instrumental).

art.subject: Art
art.question0: The student perceives visual representations accurately and can describe them.
art.question1: The student is able to evaluate works according to specific criteria.
art.question2: The student demonstrates a high degree of creativity and implements this creativity creatively.

work.subject: Work and Design
work.question0: The student analyzes and consciously perceives creative products.
work.question1: The student shows creativity in the production of individual workpieces.
work.question2: The student proceeds in a planned/considered manner when designing.
work.question3: The student realistically evaluates his/her own performance as well as the performance of others.

sport.subject: Sports
sport.question0: The student processes successes and failures in sports appropriately.
sport.question1: The student shows enjoyment of movement.
sport.question2: The student follows the rules when playing.
sport.question3: The student behaves fairly and cooperatively within the group.

history.subject: History
history.question0: The student shows interest in subject-specific questions.
history.question1: The student wants to research/investigate various topics largely independently.
history.question2: The student explains and gives reasons for his/her opinions on various topics.
history.question3: The student applies his/her knowledge correctly in performance assessments.

general.subject: General
general.question1: The student looks out not only for his/her own interests but also for those of others.
general.question2: The student likes to offer help to others.
general.question3: The student adheres to important rules of conversation.
general.question4: The student is not involved in any disputes.
general.question5: The student is very involved in group or partner work.
general.question6: The student reliably completes his/her weekly plans.
general.question7: The student ask for clarification in case of ambiguity.
general.question8: The student prepares adequately for rehearsals.
general.question9: The student works beyond the required level.
general.question10: The student returns important documents (parent letters, rehearsals) on time.
general.question11: The student neatly organizes his/her notebook entries.
general.question12: The student makes sure his/her notebook is complete.

notifications.saveFail: The data could not be saved.
notifications.retrieveFail: It was not possible to retrieve the data.
notifications.updateFail: The data could not be updated.
notifications.subject: First select a subject.

settings.title: Title
settings.resetLabel: If you are sure type YES then submit:
settings.supportText: Do you like this app? Consider supporting.
